episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including Essex Police's unique cannabis-growing team, the existence of tiny cars in France that don't require a driver's license, lemurs having a second tongue for grooming, and the peculiar geographical division of Mount Etna in Italy.

facts.fact: Essex Police has a team of six officers trained to grow cannabis.
In France, there are some cars that are so tiny that you don't even need a driver's license to drive them.
Under their main tongue, lemurs have another tongue.
If you built a house in a certain point of Italy, you can live in 10 different towns at the same time.
